snippet: Baruch Lebovits, whose prosecution divided the ultra-Orthodox Jewish community in New York, received a two-year sentence in a molestation case.
abstract: Baruch Lebovits of Brooklyn, once-prominent ultra-Orthodox Jewish cantor accused of molesting teenage boy on eight occasions, pleads guilty; Lebovits was convicted of molestation in 2010 but appeals court overturned conviction in 2012; under terms of plea agreement Lebovits will receive a sentence of two years in prison but will receive credit for the 13 months he has already received under the previous conviction.
lead_paragraph: Baruch Lebovits, whose prosecution divided the ultra-Orthodox Jewish community in New York, received a two-year sentence in a molestation case.

headline.main: Brooklyn Cantor Pleads Guilty in Sexual Abuse Case
headline.print_headline: Guilty Plea to Sex Abuse by a Cantor in Brooklyn
